title: Bug 49235: ServletContainerInitializer onStartup(Set<Class<? classSet is not expected class
description: Bug 49235: When invoking ServletContainerInitializer onStartup(Set<Class<? classSet, the output is 'MySomeClass', but I expect the output to be 'MySomeClass'. This issue seems to be related to Servlet 3.0 spec compatibility. My code works fine on Glassfish 3.0.
OB: The observed behavior is that when invoking ServletContainerInitializer onStartup(Set<Class<? classSet, the output is 'MySomeClass'.
EB: The expected behavior is that when invoking ServletContainerInitializer onStartup(Set<Class<? classSet, I expect the output to be 'MySomeClass'. This issue appears to be related to Servlet 3.0 spec compatibility.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Use ServletContainerInitializer onStartup with a Set of classes, including Class<? types.
2. Observe the output, which is currently 'MySomeClass'. The issue should become evident, as it should be 'MySomeClass'.
